main event: A witness spotted an unidentified object in the sky near Waco, Texas on May 10, 1960.
interesting points: The object was long and possibly pointed, like a ballpoint pen, and appeared to be approximately 20 times as large as a B-17 aircraft.
The witness heard the sound of a jet aircraft, which caused them to look up and see the object.
The object appeared to make a 90-degree turn from east to north with no apparent change in direction of flight.
The object was visible for only about 4 seconds before disappearing due to a possible loss of eye focus.
There were no known aircraft or balloons reported in the area at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a long, possibly pointed object, approximately 20 times the size of a B-17 aircraft
